text:
<!channel>: I’m incredibly excited to share an announcement with you. It is time, once again, for us to celebrate the majesty that is the Name of the Year. Name of the Year, or NOTY, was founded in 1983 on an Ivy League campus. Its mission has remained unchanged: to discover, verify, nominate, elect and disseminate great names. These visionaries scour police reports, newspapers, sports rosters, etc. for the best names in the world and create a tournament bracket to identify the ultimate name of the year.

And while the yearly release of this bracket has become one of our favorite moments at Uncorked, it has also completely de-railed productivity as we collectively pour through the entries, making our necessary comments on slack. This year, we want to do something a little different.

Instead of posting the link to slack now and ruining our workday, we want to experience the magnificence together over drinks at happy hour. *I would like to officially invite all of you to said happy hour, Wednesday, March 16th at 5:30pm at the Slammer Tavern.*

We will be revealing the names, matchup by matchup, allowing plenty of time for discussion and commentary. We’ll then ask you to pick your winners for cash and prizes. For more questions, or to participate, visit <#C0STTK4HE> and we’ll send you an invite to happy hour. We really really hope to see you there, and please… if you stumble across this year’s bracket, don’t spoil it for the rest of us!

Yours,
Abby, Melissa, and Matt

For additional context, here is some background about NOTY
<http://www.nameoftheyear.com/2007/02/name-of-year-started-innocently-enough.html>
And here’s the NOTY Bracket from 2015 who’s winner was Amanda Miranda Panda.
<http://i.imgur.com/2XJPAAF.png>

text: I sadly cannot attend the happy hour, but I will say that there is an employee at Walmart whose name was Power Wang.
I also cannot attend but would like to offer a copy of Better Names For Baby as a prize
UPDATE: There is no “buy-in” as the entries will be free. Prizes will include Charles’ book and a shit load of scratch tickets and/or gift cards
<@U06DFL7BP> is disqualified because his real name (Taco Pope) is on the list
In college there was a student whose paper I graded named Dongsuk Shin
I know a kid named Gamble and I'm always like :thinking_face:
i grew up with a kid whose parents couldn’t decide if they wanted to name him after angus young or axl rose so they named him axus.
Oops, this convo took a wrong turn.
